page.title: 15LITTLE BALDON FARM
page.content: Owned by Mr.A.J.Barclay, this 370 hectare farm has been managed by Mr. Hampshire for 20 years. 375 sheep graze for 10 months coming into old dairy buildings for lambing. Arable..160h wheat,60h barley,21h oats, 47h rape,16h peas,12h turnips for weaned lambs,and hay and feed for sheep On the land are spinneys planted 22 years ago,an old gravelpit with 2.6h water for teal,coot,woodcock and geese. There is a small invitation shoot of 750 pheasants and 150 partridges reared Beside the manager there are 3 men who work an 8 hour day and tend 340 acres per man; a secretary for 20 hours and an occasional gamekeeper. The manager spends 10-40% of his time in his office, according to season. He attends conferences on sheep-breeds to yield appropriate lambs for market. He visits trial plots for cereals,sprays.
